keyMoments.title: Hangan Leads Allied Forces at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Hangan, a pirate captain allied with the Whitebeard Pirates, orders his forces to charge into Marineford Bay alongside Reforte and Arthur to save Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the many allied pirate captains who joined Whitebeard's cause, demonstrating the breadth of Whitebeard's influence.

reveals.information: Allied with Whitebeard Pirates to save Ace

keyMoments.title: Reforte Joins the Charge at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Reforte, a pirate captain allied with the Whitebeard Pirates, stands alongside Hangan and Arthur as they order allied forces to charge into the bay to rescue Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces another allied pirate captain, showing the many crews willing to risk their lives for Whitebeard and Ace.

reveals.information: Allied with Whitebeard Pirates to save Ace

keyMoments.title: Luffy Arrives at Marineford from the Sky
keyMoments.description: Luffy dramatically arrives at Marineford by falling from the sky on a battleship with the escaped Impel Down prisoners, shocking all three factions present at the war.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Luffy's entrance into the war to save Ace, representing the culmination of his journey through Impel Down and changing the entire dynamic of the battle.

keyMoments.title: Luffy and Ace Reunite at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Luffy and Ace spot each other across the battlefield and call out to one another, confirming to the world that they are brothers.
keyMoments.significance: The emotional reunion between brothers that sets up the climactic moments of the Marineford War.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Emotional Moment with Garp on Execution Platform
keyMoments.description: Ace shares an emotional moment with Garp, both bursting into tears as Garp recalls wanting Ace and Luffy to become Marines. They confront the tragic outcome of their choices.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the deep emotional bond between Ace and Garp despite their opposing paths, humanizing both characters.

keyMoments.title: Reunites with Luffy at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Ace spots Luffy arriving at Marineford and calls out to him, showing both joy and horror that his brother has put himself in such danger.
keyMoments.significance: The moment Ace realizes Luffy came all this way to save him, deepening the emotional stakes of the war.

keyMoments.title: Garp's Emotional Breakdown on Execution Platform
keyMoments.description: Garp joins Ace on the execution platform and breaks down emotionally, recalling memories of young Ace and Luffy and how he wanted them to become Marines. He and Ace both cry as they face the tragic outcome.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Garp's deep internal conflict between Marine duty and family love, showing the personal tragedy underlying the war.

reveals.information: Wanted Ace and Luffy to become Marines instead of pirates

keyMoments.title: Executes Deserting Marine
keyMoments.description: Akainu confronts and executes a Marine soldier who wanted to leave the battle to return to his family, declaring he must not live with shame. This brutal act terrifies Koby and Helmeppo who witness it.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Akainu's extreme interpretation of Absolute Justice and his willingness to kill his own subordinates. This is one of the first clear death scenes in the present timeline.
keyMoments.quote: If you care for your family, you must not live with shame!

reveals.information: Willing to execute his own subordinates for desertion as part of Absolute Justice

keyMoments.title: Woshu Woshu no Mi Ability Revealed
keyMoments.description: Tsuru demonstrates her Woshu Woshu no Mi Devil Fruit ability, literally washing and hanging out pirates to dry like laundry, neutralizing them.
keyMoments.significance: First clear demonstration of Tsuru's Devil Fruit powers, establishing her as a capable combatant despite her elderly appearance.

reveals.information: Possesses the Woshu Woshu no Mi Devil Fruit that allows her to wash people like laundry

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: Controls Atmos with Puppet Powers
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo demonstrates his Devil Fruit ability by taking control of Atmos, the 13th Division Commander, forcing him to attack his own crew members.
keyMoments.significance: First clear demonstration of Doflamingo's ability to control people like puppets, showcasing psychological warfare and establishing him as a particularly dangerous Warlord.
keyMoments.quote: I'm at the center of history!

reveals.information: Can control people's bodies like puppets using his Devil Fruit powers

name.japanese: エドワード・ニューゲート

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard's Kabutowari Technique
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard uses a new technique called Kabutowari (Helmet Splitter), grabbing Vice Admiral Lonz's head and concentrating Gura Gura no Mi vibrations to defeat him in one blow.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates a focused application of Whitebeard's earthquake powers and shows he can easily defeat giant Vice Admirals even in his weakened state.

abilities.description: Whitebeard grabs an opponent's head and concentrates his Gura Gura no Mi vibrations around it, delivering crushing damage that can shatter helmets and defeat giants.

keyMoments.title: Little Oars Jr. Falls in Battle
keyMoments.description: After being attacked by multiple Warlords, Little Oars Jr. is finally defeated when Gecko Moria impales him through the midsection. Despite fatal wounds, he desperately reaches toward Ace until his last moment.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the defeat of one of the Whitebeard Pirates' most powerful allies and demonstrates the overwhelming power of the assembled Warlords. His determination shows the deep bonds within Whitebeard's crew.
